result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvin Curtis Green Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marvin Curtis Green Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marvin Curtis Green Jr was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Marvin Curtis Green Jr was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges by 04-01-2016 or the result is a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvin Curtis Green Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marvin Curtis Green in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Negotiations placed on the record. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 1: Court ordered the defendant to served 94 days in the House of Correction with credit for 94 days time served.  This is a time served disposition.

As to Count 2: Court ordered the defendant to served 94 days in the House of Correction concurrent to Count 1.

Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges by 04/01/2016 or the result is a civil judgment.  Court ordered the defendant to contact the Clerk of Court to enter into a payment plan.  Court confirmed that the defendant's address in CCAP is current. Appeal rights given.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Marvin Curtis Green in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant just released from the hospital, and not feeling well.    Parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be reassigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marvin Curtis Green in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to Counts 1 and 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
As to Count 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 3 dismissed.

Defense needs time to obtain documentation regarding the violation. Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report (positive drug test) received and filed. Defendant went to Justice Point before coming to his court appearance scheduled for 1:30pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Marvin Curtis Green in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Marvin Curtis Green in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Case in court with 15CM335.  Defense counsel requests case be set for status conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marvin Curtis Green in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case heard off the record. Case in court with 15CM335.  Case scheduled for status conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM031259  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/26/2015

Defendant Marvin Curtis Green in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Marvin Curtis Green in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case in court with 14CM3006 for a motion hearing. Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
State's Motion to Join Cases for Trial, filed.

Bail motion by the state argued and denied by the Court.  Bail and all conditions of bail to remain the same. Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court, defendant Marvin Curtis Green not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney  in court, defendant Marvin Curtis Green not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court with 14CM3006 and 15CM335.  Statements by parties regarding scheduling. This case will follow the other two.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marvin Curtis Green in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Marvin Curtis Green in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsels motion to modify bail is DENIED by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-08-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marvin Curtis Green in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Marvin Curtis Green in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
